content:  HMC/SE TLS 1.3 support The HMC and SE support TLS 1.3. Before setting the TLS level to 1.3, you must ensure that all services and servers that are connecting by way of TLS to the HMC and SE support TLS 1.3 as well (for example, the remote browser, LDAP Authentication Servers, Web Services API connections, Fibre Channel End Point Security, and FTPS, Single Object Operations). TLS 1.0 and 1.1 are not supported by Driver 51/Version 2.16.0. If minimum TLS version is set to 1.2, TLS 1.3 is attempted first and then, falls back to TLS 1.2 if required. 410 IBM z16 (3931) Technical Guide Figure 10-1 shows the HMC window that allows the selection of the wanted TLS version. Figure 10-1 Minimum TLS version selection on HMC  HMC/SE certification expiration updates The new default for HMC and SE certificate expiration is 398 days and it can be modified. This expiration period is driven by an industry shorter certificate lifespan that is used by the Apple Safari browser and iOS. A hardware
